timeline.bodyText:
@Sara4994 we have to avoid use process instance stuff in common package to keep that to find other kind of assets.
I think the generic part of the  domain explorer have to filter just by domain data, (thinking in reuse this component for other purposes)
timeline.author: nmirasch

replies.bodyText: +1 will be very hard to make it generic later on. I believe this can be avoided if you check that the attribute is of type enum. Then you can get the enum values from the schema itself.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: @cristianonicolai  i did try to get enum by having check, I got enum as type for field = state, operator = 'equal'. But in case of field = state, operator = 'in' type is provided as LIST. Thats the reason i had to keep those values in an array
replies.author: Sara4994

replies.bodyText: the ProcessInstanceStateArgument defines equal and in as types, one is a single ProcessInstanceState and the other is and array of ProcessInstanceState. If the type is a list, should be possible to get the actual type. https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-apps/blob/master/data-index/data-index-service/src/main/resources/schema.graphqls#L243
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: @cristianonicolai @nmirasch as suggested handled using query to fetch enum
replies.author: Sara4994

timeline.bodyText: It seems just a big dependency between these components, in high level, it should mostly get a domain that is needed to find out the schema object and have a method callback about when a new filter is applied
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: @cristianonicolai as discussed, removed query from ManageColumns component and some of its dependencies. Now query inside FilterOptions component works generic to handle manage columns and filters
